p: Influenza A viruses (IAVs), commonly termed flu viruses, belong to the Orthmyxoviridae family and are broadly associated with acute febrile respiratory disease in many animals. Wild aquatic birds are believed to be the reservoir for these viruses [ 1, 2]. However, although IAVs were initially limited to wild waterfowl, these viruses crossed the species barrier and have been spreading to other populations, including mammalian species, and have established independent lineages [ 1, 3, 4].
